transportAdvice: Krakow's historic Old Town and main attractions are highly walkable, with most major sights within comfortable walking distance of each other. The city also has an extensive tram and bus network covering tourist areas and outer districts, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional snow, making warm layers essential for sightseeing.
Still cold and wintry with possible snow, though daylight hours begin to increase noticeably.
Early spring brings variable weather with cool temperatures and occasional rain mixed with brighter days.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with blooming parks, though showers are common and a light jacket is still needed.
One of the best months to visit, with warm temperatures, green landscapes, and lively outdoor caf√© culture.
Warm and mostly sunny with occasional thunderstorms, ideal for exploring the city and surrounding areas.
The warmest month with long days and a vibrant festival atmosphere, though afternoon thunderstorms are possible.
Hot and sunny with the highest tourist crowds, and brief but heavy summer storms are not uncommon.
Pleasant early autumn with cooler evenings, fewer crowds, and beautiful golden tones beginning to appear.
Crisp autumn weather with colourful foliage and a quieter, more atmospheric feel to the city.
Cool and often overcast with the first frosts possible, but Christmas markets begin to appear late in the month.
Cold and festive with a charming Christmas market in the main square and occasional light snowfall adding to the atmosphere.
